description:
Cover: Lee Garbett (Judge Dredd)

  • Judge Dredd - Debris (part 3) (Michael Carroll - PJ Holden)
  • The Red Seas - Beautiful Freak (part 3) (Ian Edginton - Steve Yeowell)
  • Aquila - Blood of the Iceni (part 3) (Gordon Rennie - Leigh Gallagher)
  • The Grievous Journey of Ichabod Azrael (and the Dead left in his Wake) - Manhunt (part 6) (Rob Williams - Dom Reardon)
  • Lenny Zero - Zero's 7 (part 3) (Andy Diggle - Ben Willsher)
name: Prog 1794

description: Cayce an exiled angel from heaven attempts to save the soul of Harlan lawrence - an escaped convict who has kidnapped a school bus full of children, holding them hostage high above the city in a burning building.
name: Fire and Rain

description: "Marlowe" a bounty hunter sent by Lucifer to kill Cayce and return the souls that are being prevented from entering hell. Meanwhile Cayce tells a little girl the sad tale of "Victor" a violinist who lost the ability to play his beloved violin and shuts himself off from the world.
name: Swansong

description: Cayce finds himself drawn to a wayward priest who has lost his faith in Religion, and offers him a chance at "Salvation". Meanwhile, Marlowe is still on the hunt for Cayce.
name: Altered States of Grace

description: Can Cayce stop his pursuers, and prevent Lucifer from claiming the souls he protects? Will the centuries old "uneasy" truce between Heaven and hell be broken? and will Cayce be allowed back into heaven now that his 1000 days punishment is up? Find out in this thrilling conclusion to CandyappleBlack!
name: Wither and Bloom

description: Cayce, now dying, is determined to make one last stand for "humanity" by waring against both heaven and hell, and protect the souls of the damned he guards from "Lucifer"
name: The Heart's Filthy Lesson

description: Cayce reveals himself to "Suzanne" , and explains what happened on that night with her mother 20 years ago, when she committed suicide.
name: The Suicide King

description: Cayce finds himself trying to save Jenny, an abused girl whose only wish for her birthday is that an "Angel of Death" would save her from her stepfather's Rick's evil clutches.
name: Chocolate Suicide Cake

description: In this landmark volume collecting the first six issues of the new series featuring the story "Lightning in a Bottle" written by Danny Bilson and Paul DeMeo — creators of the groundbreaking TV series The Flash — one of the biggest questions of 2006 is answered: Who will be the new Flash?
name: Vol. 1

volume.name: The Flash: The Fastest Man Alive: Lightning in a Bottle

description: Frank Castle reloads for his one-man war on scum! Garth Ennis, Steve Dillon, and Jimmy Palmiotti keep the high-octane mayhem running strong in their follow-up to last year's hit! When the miraculous appearance of an old adversary raises a few questions, the Punisher finds himself en route to an island fortress, populated with hundreds of the world's deadliest mercenaries and killers. No problem for Frank Castle, right? Guest appearance by Spider-Man.
name: Volume 2

description: In 1977, Kiss was not only the biggest band in the world, they were the biggest comic-book stars around! For the first time ever, both classic Marvel Super Specials are collected in one in trade paperback, with story and art from Stan Lee, John Buscema, John Romita Jr., and more! Featuring an all-new cover recreation by Kiss: Avatars cover artist Nick Runge!
name: Vol. 1

description:
Dr.Grave and Shandar in “Legacy of Terror”

Our heroic pair walks straight into an occult trap where Mr.Cragg and his associates are trying to harness the power of The Corn of St.Lucius, but will Mr.Cragg and company succeed or will Dr.Grave and Shandar triumph over evil...?

To call Sergio Aragones a legendary cartoonist would be an understatement. Besides being in every single issue of Mad Magazine for the past 50 years, Sergio is also the creator of Groo the Wanderer, the hilarious character that is a good natured and extremely honest barbarian, but one who consistently finds himself in the middle of all sorts of misadventures because of his unparalleled stupidity and penchant for misunderstanding. IDW is pleased to offer the one and only Sergio Aragones' Groo the Wanderer: Artist's Edition, featuring a glorious four-part story showcasing Sergio at his best.
name: HC

volume.name: Sergio Aragones' Groo The Wanderer - Artist's Edition

description: Batman #348, Detective Comics #515

person_credits.name: Rick Geary
person_credits.role: writer, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

volume.name: Charles Starrett as The Durango Kid

description: From the great Fawcett Comics Westerns of the 1950′s comes the adventures of Monogram and Republic Pictures serial star, battlin’ Bob Steele, in a three-part action serial entitled “Dynamite Death!” Three exciting chapters: “Poisonous Fangs”, “Stampeding Terror” and “Six Gun Explosion”!! All this plus a Rocky Lane Western thriller, “The Alibi”. Of course, like all AC collector’s classics, every line of this masterful Golden Age beauty is perfectly restored, using state of the art reprographic technology. 36 pages, black and white with color photo cover, standard comic book.

The third IDWArtist's Edition (Following Dave Steven's Rocketeer and Walter Simonson's Thor) focuses on one of the all time greatest comic book artists, and at the absolute peak of his creative powers: Wally Wood. EC Comics was quite likely the finest comics line ever produced, and Wally Wood was one of their mainstays who set an incredibly high artistic standard. This volume will contain a wonderful selection of stories in original art form by Wood, including: MY WORLD, CAME THE DAWN, MARS IS HEAVEN, HE WALKED AMONG US, and more. Additionally, there will be a fantastic cover gallery section by Wood. If you've never seen Wood original art, you've never seen Wally Wood!
name: HC

volume.name: Wally Wood's EC Stories - Artist's Edition

description:
Fine artist, illustrator, and comics creator Molly Crabapple captures the absurdity of modern life in intricate, theatrical detail in her fine art work, drawing inspiration from politics, polite (and not-so-polite) society, and hundreds of years of literature. Her work is burlesque-inspired in the broadest definition of the word—deftly satirizing the powerful with adorably sinister animals, steampunk-tinged machinery, and of course, beautiful girls.

But it's not all fantastical—when Occupy Wall Street broke out, Molly was there, capturing the immediacy of the revolutionary feeling in pen and ink. In a new 48-page book from IDW, you can get Molly's art in gorgeous full-color, work that's decorated glamorous nightclubs, museums and galleries, and protest signs and occupied spaces around the country.
name: Vol. 2: Devil In the Details

description: In September 2011, artist and firebrand, Molly Crabapple, locked herself in a hotel room, covered the walls in paper and filled 270 square feet of wall with art. The project, called "Molly Crabapple's Week in Hell," is a wild ride through the imagination of an artist stretching herself to the limits of her endurance. Gorgeous photographs by Steve Prue show Ms. Crabapple's sheer talent, audacity, and ambition at work. From the first stroke of pen upon paper to the glorious 360 view of a room full of art, this book chronicles the trials and joys of the Week in Hell, including visits from some of New York City's artistic luminaries, absinthe parties, live models, and musical accompaniment.
name: Vol. 1: Week In Hell

description: Jewish Images in the Comics presents more than 150 works from all over the world demonstrating how Jewish culture has historically been depicted in comics. The book is divided into chapters such as 'Anti-Semitism', 'The Old Testament' and 'The Holocaust' and features works from well-known artists like Art Spiegelman and Will Eisner to much more obscure (and in some cases far less savory) cartoonists. Each example is spotlighted via an informative essay and a representative illustration.
name: HC

description: The Furry Trap is a harrowing and genre-bending collection of 11 modern horror short stories that could curl the toes of a corpse. Simmons' stories work on multiple levels: straight horror, black humor, genre satire and assaults against the political correctness of much of our popular culture. His artwork excels in conveying a feeling of dread and claustrophobia, and the stories herein all share an unmistakable and uncompromising commitment to exploring the crossroads of abomination and hilarity.
name: HC

person_credits.name: Josh Simmons
person_credits.role: writer, artist, letterer, inker, cover, production

description:
A deadly virus killed every adult on Earth, leaving only the kids behind. With her parents gone, Lisa is responsible for her little brother, Todd. She has to make sure they stay alive. Many kids are sick or starving, and fierce gangs are stealing and destroying everything they find. Lots of people have given up, but on Grand Avenue, some kids are surviving. Because of Lisa.

Lisa figured out how to give the kids on Grand Avenue food, homes, and protection against the gangs. But Tom Logan and his army are determined to take that away and rule the streets themselves. How long can Lisa's group keep fighting them off? They need to find a place to live safely. A strong place. A secret place.

In a world like this, someone has to take charge. But does Lisa have the strength to take charge of a whole city?

A plague turns everyone on Earth over the age of twelve to ash. In a suburb of Chicago, ten year old Lisa Nelson uses her intellect to thrive in a world without adults or utilities. With ingenuity, she manages to operate a car and scavenge from farm houses. After dropping off a haul at home, her younger brother Todd is attacked and robbed by the Chidester Avenue Gang. This prompts Lisa to organize the neighborhood kids in defense against roving thugs.

Lisa initially has success safeguarding the neighborhood and in locating a wholesale warehouse with her new friend Craig. However, after a standoff with Chidester's leader Tom Logan, the Nelsons are burned out of their house. Lisa realizes that the local high school is the safest shelter in the area, and works with her friends to fortify it in secret. Despite the work everyone does, Lisa insists that it is "her" city, since all the best ideas have been hers, and everything would break down into squabbles without her guidance. The viewpoint irks many of "her" citizens, but any unrest is quieted by her accomplished, effective leadership.

During an unsuccessful raid on the school, Tom Logan is disfigured with hot oil, which seems only to steel his resolve. Logan finally manages to trick Lisa into exiting the school, after which she is shot and left for dead. Todd, Craig and de facto nurse Jill rescue Lisa and tend to her at a farmhouse. Craig wants to give up on the school, and when Lisa refuses, quits the group. Todd returns to the school as a spy, and learns that Tom Logan has alienated most everyone there with a reign of terror that fails to sustain the community.

Lisa and company travel to nearby towns in search of mercenaries to help retake the school. They prove unnecessary, as there is a mass exodus from the school as soon as word gets out that Lisa is still alive. Lisa sneaks in alone to confront Tom Logan, who ultimately recognizes his failings and voluntarily leaves with his gang. The kids return to the school, chanting Lisa's name.
name: GN

volume.name: The Girl Who Owned a City: The Graphic Novel
